body:
The ‘X’ Guides are a series of guidebooks that have been published by the French tyre company ‘X’ since 1900.

X was established in 1899 by two French brothers Edouard M. and André M to revolutionize the tyre manufacturing industry.

X has numerous inventions to its name, including the removable tyre.

The company is the world's largest tyre manufacturer by annual revenue.

To be recommended by the ‘X’ guides soon became a sign of prestige and now represents the highest possible level of culinary expertise, creativity, and consistency.

What system do you think they came up with?
Or simply, What do you think the name of this French Tyre Company is?
answerOneLiner: The Michelin tyre company created the Michelin Guide and its star rating.

body:
"Storm X, They Can't Stop All of Us" was an American Facebook event that took place on and around September 20, 2019.

The event, created as a sardonic shitpost by Matty Roberts on June 27, 2019, asked Facebook users to band together and raid a heavily guarded site and uncover whatever secrets conspiracy lore claims are hidden within.

More than 2 million people responded "going" and 1.5 million "interested" on the event's page, which subsequently attracted widespread media attention and caused the event to become an Internet meme.

Which legendary internet event am I talking about?

English mathematician G.H. Hardy once visited X in the hospital.
He mentioned that he had arrived in a taxi numbered 1729, which he thought was a rather dull number.
X immediately replied, "No, it is very interesting. It is the smallest number expressible as the sum of two cubes in two different ways."
1729 = 10³ + 9³ = 12³ + 1³
This number is now famously known as the Hardy–X number.
Who was Hardy visiting?

This is a traditional game of GO - an ancient chinese strategy board game.
What did it inspire in the world of technology?

images.alt: Go board with black and white stones

answerOneLiner: The black–white module pattern inspired QR code design.
